report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.07.0]
**INSTITUTION Consultation Name: **NAME[AAA, BBB] Acct #: **ID-NUM MRN: **ID-NUM Admitted: Date: **DATE[Apr 03 2006] Dict: **NAME[XXX, WWW] Attend: **NAME[ZZZ, YYY] Mrs. **NAME[AAA] is an **AGE[in 80s]-year-old woman who has a hypertension, atrial fibrillation, anticoagulation, history of pneumonia, hyperthyroidism, non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, history of diarrhea. She was recently here at **INSTITUTION for those problems. She now returns with increasing dyspnea. She denies any chest pain, chest discomfort. She has a history of diabetes in addition to the above. Because of her increasing shortness of breath, she was admitted here. Presently, she is awake and alert. Blood pressure is 158/62, saturations 94%, respiratory rate is 18, rate 68. HEENT unremarkable. Chest with diminished breath sounds, right greater than left. Moderate JVD. There is a 3+ left lift. Carotids are brisk. Auscultation: S1 and S2, A2 is less than P2. Abdomen is soft, cholecystectomy scar. There is no edema. Blood pressures are elevated. K is only 3.6. BNP is 518. Chest x-ray has 3+ cardiomegaly, congestive heart failure, bilateral pleural effusion, LVH 50%. EKG: Atrial fibrillation, left anterior hemiblock, poor R wave progression. Presently, I suspect this is diastolic dysfunction with pulmonary hypertension. Presently, we are going to concentrate on getting her blood pressure under control using diuresis. Her effusions are small and I do not think they need to be intervened with. We will also correct her potassium. Hopefully, diuresis will take care of this problem. Thank you very much. ______________________________ **NAME[WWW M XXX], MD HS Job # 462270 / 36231 / SHY # **ID-NUM D: **DATE[Apr 03 2007] 10:21 T: **DATE[Apr 03 2007] 10:29
**CARBON-COPY
